result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:18 AM Defendant Jermaine A Bell in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Jermaine A Bell.  Attorney Lesli S Boese in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is prepared for trial but has a conflict with military obligations.
Defense requests adjournment of the trial.
State has no objections to the adjournment request.
Court grants adjournment request.
Jury trial still expected to last 4 days.  Court will select 2 alternates.  Each side to receive 5 strikes.  Clerk to modify the trial order.

11:13 AM Defendant Jermaine A Bell in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery but is waiting on an offer.
Defense acknowledges reciept of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea to all charges.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

approved by Judge Bohren on 2/18/22 -  ' The State is filing an amended information adding the drug repeater statute, pursuant to section 961.48. Under that statute, specifically 961.48(2m)(b)1, the statute authorizes the State at any time before entry of a guilty or no contest plea or the commencement of a trial to file, without leave of the Court, an amended information that charges an offense as a second or subsequent offense under that chapter by alleging any applicable prior convictions.'
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:09 AM Defendant Jermaine A Bell in court with attorney Robert E Webb.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Attorney Webb requests to address the conditions of bail.  The Court notes it only ordered level 2 monitoring with no drug testing and should only include one face to face contact and one alternative contact.  If this needs to be addressed further, the Court will require defense to file a bail motion to let the Judge determine if any modifications should be made.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Robert E Webb Jr.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002683,
Payable Number: 456414,
Receipt Number: 22R 003264,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant/Michaella S. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) prior to being released from custody.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is to report to WCS within 48 hours.

05:25 PM Defendant Jermaine A Bell in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
